jobs_data.title: DevOps Engineer con experiencia en Azure y Kubernetes
jobs_data.description:
¿Tienes experiencia en la gestión de infraestructuras en la nube y te apasiona la automatización? ¡Únete a nuestro equipo en una startup en expansión! Estamos desarrollando una plataforma innovadora de servicios automatizados que permite a los usuarios contratar servicios esenciales como energía, seguros y telecomunicaciones a través de  WhatsApp. Buscamos un  DevOps Engineer  con sólidos conocimientos en  Azure y  Kubernetes  para ayudarnos a construir una infraestructura escalable y de alto rendimiento que permita conectar a nuestros usuarios de manera rápida y segura.
Responsabilidades:
      -Diseñar, desplegar y mantener la infraestructura en  Kubernetes  y  Azure, asegurando la estabilidad y escalabilidad de la plataforma.
-Gestionar y optimizar pipelines de  CI/CD  para facilitar despliegues continuos y eficientes, minimizando tiempos de inactividad.
-Implementar políticas avanzadas de seguridad para proteger los datos de los usuarios y asegurar la confidencialidad de la información.
-Colaborar estrechamente con equipos de desarrollo y producto para implementar las mejores prácticas de DevOps y automatización, adaptándose a un entorno dinámico y en constante evolución.


Requisitos:
      -Experiencia demostrable en  Azure  y  Kubernetes  para la creación y administración de infraestructuras en la nube.
-Conocimientos sólidos en  CI/CD  y herramientas de automatización de despliegues.
-Familiaridad con  seguridad en DevOps  y prácticas de DevSecOps para mantener la infraestructura protegida y conforme a las normativas.
-Actitud proactiva y orientada a la resolución de problemas, con capacidad de adaptación en un entorno de startup.
-Inglés con nivel profesional para poder trabajar con nuestros partners.


Ofrecemos:
      -Salario competitivo según capacidades.
-Oportunidad de formar parte de un equipo en crecimiento y de un proyecto innovador desde sus inicios, donde tus ideas y contribuciones marcarán la diferencia.
-Modalidad híbrida de trabajo, con base en Granada y posibilidad de teletrabajo.
-Un entorno dinámico en una startup, donde cada miembro del equipo tiene voz y contribuye activamente al desarrollo de la plataforma.

jobs_data.title: Programador/a .NET MOM
jobs_data.location: Aranda de Duero, Castilla and Leon, Spain
jobs_data.description: Descripción ¿Te apasiona la tecnología? ¿Quieres desarrollarte en una empresa dinámica y en constante crecimiento? ¡Te estamos buscando! En Nunsys Group estamos ampliando nuestro equipo, buscamos un/a Programador/a .NET MOM para incorporarse en nuestra delegación de Aranda de Duero, Valencia o Sevilla. Nuestro viaje empezó en 2007 y tenemos una meta: ser la empresa española líder en tecnología. Nos apasiona la transformación digital y contamos con un gran portfolio de soluciones tecnológicas. Gracias a esto garantizamos que podemos afrontar cualquier reto que nos planteen nuestros clientes. Actualmente somos más de 2.600 profesionales y tenemos presencia en 25 ciudades españolas, Portugal, USA, Colombia y Ecuador. ¡Y esto es solo el principio! El proyecto ¿en qué consiste? El día a día es muy variado, pero algunas de las funciones en las que participarás son: -Participarás en proyectos nacionales e internacionales en empresas lideres del sector Food&Beverage como desarrollador de aplicaciones para soluciones MOM como LIMS , PDM y R&D. -Formarás parte de un equipo de alto conocimiento y se desarrollarás como profesional en la interpretación de necesidades de nuestros clientes y en aplicar las solucione necesarias para obtener los objetivos deseados para cada proyecto. -Las soluciones que desarrollarás tendrán aplicaciones en la formulación de nuevos productos, en la gestion de la calidad y los laboratorios de las empresas y en la gestion de proyectos globales. -Formarás parte de un equipo con metodología Agile y SCRUM. Requisitos 🌟 ¿Qué estamos buscando? -Buscamos personas con una gran capacidad de organización y una metodología de trabajo impecable, en este equipo todos/as sumamos. -En Nunsys Group el compañerismo es esencial. Nos apoyamos mutuamente para superar cualquier desafío y alcanzar nuestros objetivos en equipo. -Tener una mínima experiencia en el desarrollo de aplicaciones informáticas con el framework .NET o similar . -Conocer las estructuras básicas y funciones de bases de datos SQL. -Manejo de estructuras XML y JSON. -Tener grado superior como desarrollador de aplicaciones informáticas. Si tienes experiencia en el puesto y quieres formar parte de nuestro equipo ¡vamos por el buen camino! 🔝 ¿Algo más con lo que aportar valor? Es necesario leer y entender Inglés para la documentación y las formaciones que se imparten por parte de nuestro proveedor de software. ¿Nos eliges? Con nosotros encontrarás: 💼 Contrato indefinido en una empresa líder en el sector 💰 Paquete retributivo competitivo acorde a los conocimientos y experiencia aportados 🌴 Jornada intensiva los meses de julio y agosto y todos los viernes del año. 📚En nuestro equipo creemos en las personas y en su talento, por eso apostamos por la formación de nuestros profesionales. 💳Posibilidad de acogerte al programa de retribución flexible: Ticket Guardería, Ticket restaurante, Tarjeta transporte y Seguro Médico. 🤑Descuentos en distintos establecimientos, productos (electrodomésticos, moda, tecnología) y servicios (viajes, alquiler de vehículos, salud). 💗 Un ambiente diverso y sobre todo inclusivo donde lo primero son las personas. 🎉 ¡No todo es trabajo, también hay tiempo para la diversión! Tenemos diferentes eventos a lo largo del año, desde nuestro "Christmas Jumper Day" hasta nuestro concurso de disfraces en Halloween, siempre buscamos formas de crear un ambiente divertido. ¡Y muchas más cosas que queremos que conozcas! ¿Quieres unirte a nosotros/as y ser parte del cambio? Queremos informar a todo interesado/a en nuestras ofertas de empleo que las únicas ofertas vigentes están publicadas en nuestra página web https://empleo.nunsys.com/ o https://www.sothis.tech/unete-al-equipo/, no debiendo confiar en portales que simplemente se limitan a agregar la información de nuestras ofertas con objeto recabar sus datos personales. Localización (Híbrido)

jobs_data.title: IT Application Engineer
jobs_data.description:
Job Description Summary  As a Application Engineer, you will be responsible for managing and enhancing our suite of intranet applications that cover all functional domains within an electronics manufacturing plant. Your role will also involve delivering applications for Grid Automation DT projects globally. You will leverage your expertise in ASP.NET, Oracle DB, Windows Server, IIS technologies, and SAP to ensure the successful delivery and maintenance of these applications. Additionally, you will utilize your experience in DevOps, support management (ITSM), ISO 27001/2 audits, and global project management to drive excellence. Your role will also include managing IT networks, backup systems, and IT infrastructure asset management. Your ability to quickly learn and manage existing applications, combined with effective teamwork and a customer-centric approach, will be key to your success in this role.  Job Description  

Key Responsibilities

      -Application Management: Oversee the suite of intranet applications, ensuring they meet the functional needs of the electronics manufacturing plant. Manage updates, improvements, and issue resolution.
-Technical Expertise: Utilize your strong background in ASP.NET, Oracle DB, Windows Server, IIS technologies, and SAP to deliver and maintain high-quality applications.
-Process Knowledge: Apply your process knowledge and hands-on experience with SAP to manage and enhance applications, ensuring alignment with business processes and operational requirements.
-Global Projects: Develop and deliver applications as required for Grid Automation DT projects worldwide. Collaborate with international teams to meet project objectives.
-Customer Focus: Actively engage with stakeholders to understand their needs and ensure that applications align with their requirements. Provide exceptional customer service and support.
-Team Collaboration: Work effectively as a team player, contributing to project success and fostering a collaborative work environment. Demonstrate a proactive and go-getter attitude.
-Learning & Adaptation: Quickly familiarize yourself with the existing suite of applications to manage and enhance them effectively. Adapt to changes and new requirements as needed.
-Project Management: Apply project management skills, utilizing either waterfall or Agile methodologies, to ensure projects are delivered on time and within scope.
-DevOps Experience: Utilize DevOps practices and tools to streamline development and operations.
-Support Management & ITSM: Manage support operations and IT Service Management (ITSM) processes.
-ISO 27001/2 Audits: Oversee and ensure compliance with ISO 27001/2 audit requirements.
-IT Network Management: Manage IT networks, ensuring stability, security, and performance.
-Backup Systems: Oversee backup systems to ensure data integrity and recovery capabilities.
-IT Infrastructure Asset Management: Manage IT infrastructure assets, including tracking, maintenance, and lifecycle management.
-Communication Skills: Communicate clearly and effectively in English and Spanish, both written and verbal.



Qualifications

      -Experience: Proven track record in delivering and managing applications for electronics manufacturing plants or similar industries.
-Technical Skills: Strong expertise in ASP.NET, Oracle DB, Windows Server, IIS technologies, and hands-on experience with SAP.
-Process Knowledge: In-depth understanding of business processes related to electronics manufacturing and how they integrate with SAP.
-Education: Preferred certifications in relevant skills and technologies.
-Project Management: Experience with project management methodologies (waterfall or Agile).
-Language Proficiency: Excellent English and Spanish language skills, both written and verbal.
-Travel: Willingness to travel up to 2-3 times a year as required.



Preferred Attributes

      -Solutioning: Deep process knowledge with a solution-oriented mindset.
-Customer Empathy: Skilled in understanding and addressing customer needs effectively.
-Effective Team Player: Collaborative and proactive approach to teamwork.
-Quick Learner: Ability to swiftly grasp and manage existing systems and applications.
-Transparency: Open mindset with the ability to adopt global processes at a local scale.
-DevOps Experience: Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools.
-Support Management & ITSM: Experience in support management and IT Service Management (ITSM) practices.
-ISO 27001/2 Audits: Experience with ISO 27001/2 audits and compliance.
-Communication Skills: Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with proficiency in English and Spanish.
-IT Network Management: Expertise in managing IT networks, backup systems, and IT infrastructure assets.



  Additional Information  

Relocation Assistance Provided:  No

jobs_data.title: PHP Developer (Symfony)
jobs_data.description:
Hybrid / Madrid-based / English and Spanish Required

(NOT contractor/freelance)

Are you one of those PHP Engineers who loves to learn from and teach your colleagues, push yourself to the limit, and take part in very demanding projects with the latest technology?

At Cognizant Spain we have got the Engineering Community that you’ll want to be part of: great team to count on, continuous training, and interesting projects!

As a PHP Engineer, you will get an opportunity to understand the client business requirements and contribute to the design, concentrate on the pure technical solution, learn new technologies and work in agile environment. You will become an active member of the PHP Competency team that works closely with other disciplines/roles.

Why choose us?

      -HIGH-QUALITY PROJECTS. You will participate in demanding projects mainly focused on digitization or even start projects from scratch. Show us what you are made of!
-LATEST TECHNOLOGIES. We know you are passionate about the fascinating world of PHP, so you will continue to grow in this field working with technologies such as Symfony.  
-DEVELOPER COMMUNITY: We all want to be part of something! Here we have built an amazing community that will give you the opportunity to share your knowledge and experience, participate in TedTalks or even lead them! If you are a creative person, here you will be able to come up with new ideas, don't be afraid to speak up!
-LEARNING. Your current knowledge is never enough, is it? You will have access to learning platforms that will train you to become an expert or even start learning some of those skills you know you have been wanting to study for a long time.
-TEAMWORK. This team will always be there for you! We know you're tough and have a “no task too small” attitude, but you'll always have a talented teammate to count on if you need one!
-INTERNATIONAL TEAM. If you stand out among your teammates because you have a great level of communication in English, you'll be able to put it into practice! If it's not your strongest suit, don’t worry! Here’s where you can improve it by working alongside teams distributed all around the world.
-CAREER PLAN. It is a fact, here you’ll grow in every direction: vertically towards gaining more responsibilities and increasing in category, and horizontally towards learning new technologies and becoming an expert in your business.



Other Benefits That You’ll Find

      -Restaurant tickets for every working day!
-Permanent contract: you are here to grow with us!
-Flexible retribution for the Gympass and nursery tickets: take care of your health and your children!
-Referral program: it’s time to bring your colleagues to an awesome team and get rewarded for it!
-Salary and bonuses: it’s a matter of reaching an agreement. We’ll discuss it on our first call!



What will make you successful in this position?

      -PHP con el framework de Symfony
-Frontend: Views Twig with a UI component library in JQuery (DevExtreme), HTML, CSS
-BBDD: Mysql, ORM - Doctrine
-CI/CD: GitLab
-Work in an Agile, cross-functional team developing highly innovative digital products.  
-Design, implement and test features and services based on user stories in a test-driven Agile development process.
-With your team, take end-to-end responsibility for technical and operational aspects of your deliveries.
-Successfully completed Information Technology studies, an equivalent education or equivalent work experience  
-Profound software development background with modern programming languages
-Thoroughly familiar with standard best practices: OOP, Enterprise architectural patterns, SOLID, KISS, DRY etc.
-Strong background in data structures and algorithms
-Software product development experience and mindset
-Knowledge of agile software development  
-Business fluent English and Spanish required



To sum up!

Apply to this position if you want to continue being a successful PHP Engineer surrounded by a healthy and trendy environment!

-Conocimientos sólidos en  CI/CD  y herramientas de automatización de despliegues.
-Familiaridad con  seguridad en DevOps  y prácticas de DevSecOps para mantener la infraestructura protegida y conforme a las normativas.
-Actitud proactiva y orientada a la resolución de problemas, con capacidad de adaptación en un entorno de startup.

-Modalidad híbrida de trabajo, con base en Granada y posibilidad de teletrabajo.

jobs_data.title: Programador/a .NET MOM
jobs_data.location: Aranda de Duero, Castilla and Leon, Spain
jobs_data.description: Descripción ¿Te apasiona la tecnología? ¿Quieres desarrollarte en una empresa dinámica y en constante crecimiento? ¡Te estamos buscando! En Nunsys Group estamos ampliando nuestro equipo, buscamos un/a Programador/a .NET MOM para incorporarse en nuestra delegación de Aranda de Duero, Valencia o Sevilla. Nuestro viaje empezó en 2007 y tenemos una meta: ser la empresa española líder en tecnología. Nos apasiona la transformación digital y contamos con un gran portfolio de soluciones tecnológicas. Gracias a esto garantizamos que podemos afrontar cualquier reto que nos planteen nuestros clientes. Actualmente somos más de 2.600 profesionales y tenemos presencia en 25 ciudades españolas, Portugal, USA, Colombia y Ecuador. ¡Y esto es solo el principio! El proyecto ¿en qué consiste? El día a día es muy variado, pero algunas de las funciones en las que participarás son: -Participarás en proyectos nacionales e internacionales en empresas lideres del sector Food&Beverage como desarrollador de aplicaciones para soluciones MOM como LIMS , PDM y R&D. -Formarás parte de un equipo de alto conocimiento y se desarrollarás como profesional en la interpretación de necesidades de nuestros clientes y en aplicar las solucione necesarias para obtener los objetivos deseados para cada proyecto. -Las soluciones que desarrollarás tendrán aplicaciones en la formulación de nuevos productos, en la gestion de la calidad y los laboratorios de las empresas y en la gestion de proyectos globales. -Formarás parte de un equipo con metodología Agile y SCRUM. Requisitos 🌟 ¿Qué estamos buscando? -Buscamos personas con una gran capacidad de organización y una metodología de trabajo impecable, en este equipo todos/as sumamos. -En Nunsys Group el compañerismo es esencial. Nos apoyamos mutuamente para superar cualquier desafío y alcanzar nuestros objetivos en equipo. -Tener una mínima experiencia en el desarrollo de aplicaciones informáticas con el framework .NET o similar . -Conocer las estructuras básicas y funciones de bases de datos SQL. -Manejo de estructuras XML y JSON. -Tener grado superior como desarrollador de aplicaciones informáticas. Si tienes experiencia en el puesto y quieres formar parte de nuestro equipo ¡vamos por el buen camino! 🔝 ¿Algo más con lo que aportar valor? Es necesario leer y entender Inglés para la documentación y las formaciones que se imparten por parte de nuestro proveedor de software. ¿Nos eliges? Con nosotros encontrarás: 💼 Contrato indefinido en una empresa líder en el sector 💰 Paquete retributivo competitivo acorde a los conocimientos y experiencia aportados 🌴 Jornada intensiva los meses de julio y agosto y todos los viernes del año. 📚En nuestro equipo creemos en las personas y en su talento, por eso apostamos por la formación de nuestros profesionales. 💳Posibilidad de acogerte al programa de retribución flexible: Ticket Guardería, Ticket restaurante, Tarjeta transporte y Seguro Médico. 🤑Descuentos en distintos establecimientos, productos (electrodomésticos, moda, tecnología) y servicios (viajes, alquiler de vehículos, salud). 💗 Un ambiente diverso y sobre todo inclusivo donde lo primero son las personas. 🎉 ¡No todo es trabajo, también hay tiempo para la diversión! Tenemos diferentes eventos a lo largo del año, desde nuestro "Christmas Jumper Day" hasta nuestro concurso de disfraces en Halloween, siempre buscamos formas de crear un ambiente divertido. ¡Y muchas más cosas que queremos que conozcas! ¿Quieres unirte a nosotros/as y ser parte del cambio? Queremos informar a todo interesado/a en nuestras ofertas de empleo que las únicas ofertas vigentes están publicadas en nuestra página web https://empleo.nunsys.com/ o https://www.sothis.tech/unete-al-equipo/, no debiendo confiar en portales que simplemente se limitan a agregar la información de nuestras ofertas con objeto recabar sus datos personales. Localización (Híbrido)

jobs_data.title: DevOps Engineer con experiencia en Azure y Kubernetes
jobs_data.description:
¿Tienes experiencia en la gestión de infraestructuras en la nube y te apasiona la automatización? ¡Únete a nuestro equipo en una startup en expansión! Estamos desarrollando una plataforma innovadora de servicios automatizados que permite a los usuarios contratar servicios esenciales como energía, seguros y telecomunicaciones a través de  WhatsApp. Buscamos un  DevOps Engineer  con sólidos conocimientos en  Azure y  Kubernetes  para ayudarnos a construir una infraestructura escalable y de alto rendimiento que permita conectar a nuestros usuarios de manera rápida y segura.
Responsabilidades:
      -Diseñar, desplegar y mantener la infraestructura en  Kubernetes  y  Azure, asegurando la estabilidad y escalabilidad de la plataforma.
-Gestionar y optimizar pipelines de  CI/CD  para facilitar despliegues continuos y eficientes, minimizando tiempos de inactividad.
-Implementar políticas avanzadas de seguridad para proteger los datos de los usuarios y asegurar la confidencialidad de la información.
-Colaborar estrechamente con equipos de desarrollo y producto para implementar las mejores prácticas de DevOps y automatización, adaptándose a un entorno dinámico y en constante evolución.


Requisitos:
      -Experiencia demostrable en  Azure  y  Kubernetes  para la creación y administración de infraestructuras en la nube.
-Conocimientos sólidos en  CI/CD  y herramientas de automatización de despliegues.
-Familiaridad con  seguridad en DevOps  y prácticas de DevSecOps para mantener la infraestructura protegida y conforme a las normativas.
-Actitud proactiva y orientada a la resolución de problemas, con capacidad de adaptación en un entorno de startup.
-Inglés con nivel profesional para poder trabajar con nuestros partners.


Ofrecemos:

-Oportunidad de formar parte de un equipo en crecimiento y de un proyecto innovador desde sus inicios, donde tus ideas y contribuciones marcarán la diferencia.
-Modalidad híbrida de trabajo, con base en Granada y posibilidad de teletrabajo.

jobs_data.title: QA Engineer
jobs_data.description: “Delivering innovative digital magazines on every device in every country” Zinio brings innovation and inspiration to the world of magazine publishers and consumers by delivering the ultimate digital reading experience on any device. As a pioneer Zinio operates online web newsstands and award-winning iOS and Android apps, providing access to digital magazines & articles in more than 30 languages, which can be read online and offline on any platform.Zinio Pro converts print magazines to digital content through a Software as a service (SaaS) platform that transforms PDF to other formats such as XML, ePub, or ANF and distributes it to different platforms such as Amazon Kindle, Apple News, or Zinio Pro’s white label publisher web and mobile apps. The company has delivered 750M digital magazine editions across more than 8,5k titles from 1.3k publishers in 200 countries to over 10M customers. We are looking for the best and brightest minds in QA. Become part of an agile team of highly skilled and motivated individuals in our Barcelona office What you will be doing: -Defining appropriate measures to ensure product quality. -Performing manual and automated System tests (functional/non-functional & regression), acceptance, and integration testing. -Developing the architecture of the testing frameworks. -Working closely with Product Owners and Developers to understand product specifics and create corresponding test plans, test cases, and test strategies. -Providing technical vision choosing the technology stack that better fits the business. -Ensuring the documentation is self-explanatory, reliable, and up to date. What we expect from you: -+2 years hands-on experience in automation -Java or any other Object-Oriented Programming Language for writing automated tests. -Domain of Appium or similar software to test mobile devices. -Testing mobile applications (iOS and Android). -Have knowledge of Device farm tools. -Have absolutely zero problems communicating yourself in English. Nice to have: -Testing REST APIs, web, desktop. -Experience with TestNG, Jenkins, Gherkin/Cucumber, CI, Gradle. -ISTQB certifications. Soft skills -Self-taught and highly perfectionist, code as a craft spirit. -Enthusiastic, engaged, pro-active, and creative team player. -Honest, direct, responsible, and transparent. -Communication abilities to work with co-workers located around the world. Why You’ll Love Working with us: -We are a technology company and we invest in technology! -We lead our sector of activity and we are launching a new platform “from scratch”. We are facing very challenging new projects! -Highly skilled Engineering team so you can learn from your colleagues: knowledge sharing is strongly encouraged and lived. -Agile/ Scrum way of working and philosophy. -You will be part of a multi-cultural team, working with different countries and time zones. -We have a fun friendly international work environment. -Flexible working hours and availability of work from home. We Offer Great Benefits Including: -Team-building activities. -Free digital magazines. -Fresh fruit, tea & good (unlimited) coffee. We offer a competitive salary package and a flexible salary plan including: -Health Insurance Program. -Meal, Public Transportation Card & Nursery. -Training. By applying for this position, you accept the Candidate Privacy Policy

jobs_data.title: SOFTWARE COMPONENT ENGINEER
jobs_data.description:
Sobre nosotros  

Una carrera en Hitachi Rail te ayudará a tener un legado. Con actividades en todos los rincones del mundo, nuestro trabajo está a la vanguardia de la transformación digital y la tecnología. Desde la fuerza multicultural de nuestra organización global a la sostenibilidad e innovación trabajamos para atraer a las personas, hay algo para que todos/as se enganchen. Y ahí es donde entras tú.

Madrid, Spain (Hybrid)

En Hitachi Rail buscamos una persona que realice el desarrollo y mantenimiento en las herramientas de apoyo a la Ingeniería de datos de ERTMS.

  ¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?  


      -  Desarrollo y mantenimiento de herramientas de apoyo a la ingeniería y parametrización de ERTMS / enclavamientos electrónicos.
-  Análisis de incidencias y errores.
-  Análisis y definición de requisitos software, desarrollo de nuevas funcionalidades para herramientas de preparación de datos de sistemas de ERTMS.
-  Documentar los trabajos realizados, aplicando los procesos definidos para cada sistema.




  ¿Qué perfil buscamos?  


      -  Ingeniero/a Técnico o Superior en Informática, Telecomunicaciones, Industriales o equivalente.
-  Que tenga conocimientos en sistemas de protección del tren, aplicaciones de Seguridad, sistemas de señalización y especificaciones técnicas sistemas ERTMS.
-  Que cuente con conocimientos en lenguaje de programación C++ en entorno de Visual Studio, Base de datos SQL y lenguaje T-SQL, Metalenguaje XML, Sistema de control de versiones GIT (nivel de usuario), amplios conocimientos de informática a nivel de usuario, sistemas Operativos Windows, Jira, conocimientos en JAVA y herramientas de introducción de datos.




Y nosotros...¿Qué te ofrecemos?


      -Periodos vacacionales de 35 días laborales aproximadamente.
-Hitachi Rail Concilia que incluye servicios para tu cuidado y el de tu entorno.
-Posibilidad de teletrabajo, trabaja desde casa hasta 3 días a la semana.
-Flexibilidad horaria de hasta 2 horas en la entrada y salida.
-Área de salud y bienestar con servicio médico, sala de lactancia, ¡y acceso a diferentes actividades e iniciativas que cuidan tu salud!
-Plan de Formación anual adaptado a tu puesto de trabajo en habilidades, idiomas, competencias técnicas...
-Una organización que considera la diversidad y la inclusón dos pilares estratégicos: trabajamos por la igualdad de género, queremos que todas las generaciones convivan y aprendan unas de otras; nos enriquecemos con todas las culturas y nacionalidades, pensamos que todas las capacidades son útiles y necesarias, y creamos un ambiente seguro para todas las personas, independientemente de su orientación sexual.  
-¿Dónde estamos? Nuestras oficinas se encuentran en Serrano Galvache, 56 (metro línea 1 - Bambú).




Gracias por tu interés en Hitachi Rail. Si tu solicitud es de interés, nos pondremos en contacto contigo. Por favor, no dudes en descubrir más sobre nosotros y nuestras nuevas vacantes en https://www.hitachirail.com/careers .

En Hitachi Rail, hay un lugar para todos/as. Acogemos y valoramos las diferentes experiencias, edad, género, sexualidad, situación familiar, discapacidad, origen, nacionalidad, etnia, religión, y visión del mundo. Es nuestro compromiso crear un entorno inclusivo - estamos orgullosos/as de ser un empleador paritario.  

Nos encantaría que fueras uno/a de nuestros/as seguidores/as en https://www.linkedin.com/company/hitachirail .

jobs_data.title: Firmware Engineer - Avionics and Flight System
jobs_data.location: Tres Cantos, Community of Madrid, Spain
jobs_data.description:
Sener is currently looking for Firmware Engineers (Senior and Junior) to join our Avionics and Flight System Division at our Tres Cantos work center (Madrid).

We are a pioneering engineering company in the design of satellite technology and equipment for space exploration. In defence, we design and produce equipment and systems, including unmanned systems. Our passion for precision has made us a trusted partner of leading space agencies, government agencies and companies.

What you will do:

      -Lead the definition and implementation of FW solutions: architectures, FW components, Ifs, requirements, test resources, pin-out…
-Preparation of FPGA specifications.
-Testing and debugging the developed solutions.
-Understanding HW/SW platform and being able to define SW/HW, SW/FW IFs.
-Break down the defined solution into affordable FW component and tasks, according to project context: schedule, profiles, platform…
-Participate in proposals preparation.



What we expect from you:

      -Engineering Degree.
-Between 2-6 years background in FPGA development areas (space or automotive markets preferred). Larger experiences will be as well very welcome.
-Experience in all stages of FW lifecycle: requirements & spec, architecture definition, FW implementation, validation, integration.
-Experience in defining/implementing FW architectures.
-Be able to gather and analytically understand user requirements, providing guideless for the solution not only focusing on the FPGA but as well, SW/FW/HW approaches (being able to understand requirements impact on HW and SW solutions).
-Ability to communicate technical approaches and details within small project teams, including team interactions and presentations.
-Excellent oral and written communication skills and ability to clearly articulate customer technical needs into technical specifications.
-High level of English.



We will also value:

      -Knowledge on different development environments (Xilinx, Microsemi, Questa).
-Experience in VHDL programming.
-Experience in Simulink and Matlab.
-Knowledge in C++, C#, Phyton, Go, and/or distributed OS.
-Experience in the implementation of data/signal processing solutions.
-Experience in space, automotive or defence industry environments.



What we offer:

These are some of the benefits you will enjoy at Sener:

      -Join a multidisciplinary and highly qualified team participating in technologically innovative projects at an international level.
-Continue your professional development with us and access a wide range of training (technical training, skills, languages ...).
-Take care of yourself with our physical and emotional well-being program: sports, workshops, medical service, physiotherapy ...
-Optimize your salary with our flexible remuneration plan (meal card, private health insurance, daycare tickets, etc.) and have our life and accident insurance.
-Make the way you work more flexible! We have flexible hours, teleworking policy, coworking spaces...
-Discount portal for you and specific onboarding for our international employees.
-We promote equal opportunities, diversity and inclusion of all people and we are certified as a Entidad Familiarmente responsable - efr. And from the Sener Foundation we collaborate in activities that promote the search for knowledge and contribute to the socially responsible development of engineering.



If you feel identified, we will wait for you… at Sener we want to go as far as you want to go!

jobs_data.title: Rev-celerator Graduate Programme: Backend Java Software Engineer
jobs_data.description: About Revolut People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day. As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution. About The Role Our Technology team isn’t just one of the best in the industry. It’s one of the best in the world. And we’re proud of it. It’s our driving force, our engine. From building a new financial backend to creating an innovative app that millions of people around the world will use, there’s nothing (and we mean nothing) our tech team can’t do. About The Rev-Celerator Graduate Programme 🎓 Are you a recent graduate eager to shape the future of finance? Ready to make a meaningful impact and bring innovative ideas to life? Well, the Rev-celerator Graduate Software Engineer programme is designed just for you. First, kick off with a few weeks of bootcamp, where we’ll prepare you to jump into work at Revolut with workshops, lectures, and practical exercises to start developing your skills. After successful preparation, we’ll launch you into on-the-job training where you’ll be face-to-face with tough challenges, problem-solving, and tasks to own. The Rev-celerator Graduate programme is now open to international candidates willing to relocate to our tech hubs in Poland, Portugal, and Spain. Get support on visa application (if needed), relocation cost and the first month of accommodation. We’re looking for Java Engineers interested in every step, stage, and release of a feature. Want to work alone? This isn’t for you. We want communicators. One minute you’re chatting to a Product Owner, the next a Designer, and then a customer (for feature feedback, we don’t need you on the phones). Like your projects varied? This is for you. We don’t pigeonhole. We want you to spread your wings to as many places as possible. Up for the challenge? Let's get in touch 🚀 What You’ll Be Doing -Collaborating with engineers across various tech stacks -Building mobile APIs -Developing micro-services to evolve our architecture -Optimising existing critical systems that our business depends on, such as Risk Management, Fraud Detection, andPayment Processing -Focusing on new greenfield projects and development work. What You'll Need -A 2:1 predicted or achieved grade (or above) -To have graduated university in 2023, 2024, or 2025 -A portfolio of multiple coding side projects or open source contributions -Studies of Computer Science, Maths, Physics, or a similar subject -A proactive attitude -Love for problem-solving -Fluency in English -Quick learner with an ambitious and results-driven personality -Excellent communication and organisational skills -To feel comfortable working as part of a team in a fast-paced environment -Full-time availability for the programme starting in September 2025 Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team. Refer to our https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

jobs_data.title: Software Engineer II - Testing Infrastructure
jobs_data.description: Testing Infrastructure aims to provide the tooling and platforms which allow Datadog developers to ship services at scale with ease and confidence. Engineers on this team will have organization-wide impact by increasing development velocity and the reliability of our products and systems. As an engineer on a growing team, you will have many opportunities to work on green-field projects and help shape the future of Datadog developer experience. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships that it builds, the creativity it brings to the table, and the collaboration of being together. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our employees can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You'll Do: -Work on platforms and tooling that enable engineers to run, debug, and test their services across multiple environments -Build out a new integration testing platform and tooling to help onboard new and existing tests -Improving our visibility into test health to help developers write and maintain effective tests -Champion best practices across the engineering organization Who You Are: -You have 2+ years of experience working on services or infrastructure in a microservice-heavy environment -You have experience collaborating with internal or external customer teams -You have proficiency in at least one of Python, Go, and/or Java -You have familiarity with DevOps and resilience best practices -You have strong written and verbal communication skills -You take a curious and solution-oriented approach to challenges Bonus points for: -You have interests that bridge infrastructure, developer experience, and reliability. -You have experience building out and deploying containerized services with Kubernetes and cloud providers such as AWS or GCP -You have driven improvements to testing capabilities and/or practices for developers across teams, platforms, or organizations Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: -New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) -Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing -Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking -An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups) -Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussions -Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ -Competitive global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. About Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center. Equal Opportunity at Datadog: Datadog is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our Candidate Legal Notices for your reference. Your Privacy: Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice.

jobs_data.title: .NET Developer
jobs_data.description:
Desde Robert Walters, estamos en búsqueda de un .NET Developer para una importante empresa final del sector logístico.¿Te interesa un cambio? No dudes en apuntarte a la oferta y comentamos!  Desde Robert Walters, nos encontramos en búsqueda de un  .NET Developer  para unirse a un equipo altamente cualificado y dinámico en una reconocida empresa tecnológica nacional, ubicada en el  Vallès Oriental.Esta oportunidad surge como parte del continuo proceso de expansión y crecimiento del equipo tecnológico de la empresa. El puesto está orientado a profesionales que busquen trabajar en un entorno colaborativo, con proyectos desafiantes y con un equipo que valora tanto el desarrollo profesional como la mejora continua.Requisitos:      -Más de 3 años de experiencia en desarrollo con  .NET  (C# y Visual Basic).
-Experiencia demostrable en  desarrollo de APIs / Web Services.
-Conocimientos sólidos en bases de datos, preferentemente  SQL Server y MySQL.
-Familiaridad con  entornos Cloud, especialmente en  Azure.
-Capacidad para trabajar de manera autónoma y en equipo, con un enfoque en resultados y calidad.

Se ofrece:      -Horario flexible, con jornada intensiva los viernes
-Beneficios adicionales como  seguro médico,  póliza de vida,  clases de idiomas  y  fruta semanal  en la oficina.
-Modalidad  presencial  en la zona del Vallès Oriental
-La oportunidad de formar parte de un equipo que apuesta por el crecimiento y el desarrollo profesional, ofreciendo proyectos innovadores en los que podrás aprender y aportar.

Si estás buscando un proyecto desafiante y la oportunidad de crecer profesionalmente en un entorno colaborativo, dinámico y en constante evolución, ¡esta es tu oportunidad!

jobs_data.title: SOFTWARE COMPONENT ENGINEER
jobs_data.description:
Sobre nosotros  

Una carrera en Hitachi Rail te ayudará a tener un legado. Con actividades en todos los rincones del mundo, nuestro trabajo está a la vanguardia de la transformación digital y la tecnología. Desde la fuerza multicultural de nuestra organización global a la sostenibilidad e innovación trabajamos para atraer a las personas, hay algo para que todos/as se enganchen. Y ahí es donde entras tú.

Madrid, Spain (Hybrid)

En Hitachi Rail buscamos una persona que realice el desarrollo y mantenimiento en las herramientas de apoyo a la Ingeniería de datos de ERTMS.

  ¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?  


      -  Desarrollo y mantenimiento de herramientas de apoyo a la ingeniería y parametrización de ERTMS / enclavamientos electrónicos.
-  Análisis de incidencias y errores.
-  Análisis y definición de requisitos software, desarrollo de nuevas funcionalidades para herramientas de preparación de datos de sistemas de ERTMS.
-  Documentar los trabajos realizados, aplicando los procesos definidos para cada sistema.




  ¿Qué perfil buscamos?  


      -  Ingeniero/a Técnico o Superior en Informática, Telecomunicaciones, Industriales o equivalente.
-  Que tenga conocimientos en sistemas de protección del tren, aplicaciones de Seguridad, sistemas de señalización y especificaciones técnicas sistemas ERTMS.
-  Que cuente con conocimientos en lenguaje de programación C++ en entorno de Visual Studio, Base de datos SQL y lenguaje T-SQL, Metalenguaje XML, Sistema de control de versiones GIT (nivel de usuario), amplios conocimientos de informática a nivel de usuario, sistemas Operativos Windows, Jira, conocimientos en JAVA y herramientas de introducción de datos.




Y nosotros...¿Qué te ofrecemos?


      -Periodos vacacionales de 35 días laborales aproximadamente.
-Hitachi Rail Concilia que incluye servicios para tu cuidado y el de tu entorno.
-Posibilidad de teletrabajo, trabaja desde casa hasta 3 días a la semana.
-Flexibilidad horaria de hasta 2 horas en la entrada y salida.
-Área de salud y bienestar con servicio médico, sala de lactancia, ¡y acceso a diferentes actividades e iniciativas que cuidan tu salud!
-Plan de Formación anual adaptado a tu puesto de trabajo en habilidades, idiomas, competencias técnicas...
-Una organización que considera la diversidad y la inclusón dos pilares estratégicos: trabajamos por la igualdad de género, queremos que todas las generaciones convivan y aprendan unas de otras; nos enriquecemos con todas las culturas y nacionalidades, pensamos que todas las capacidades son útiles y necesarias, y creamos un ambiente seguro para todas las personas, independientemente de su orientación sexual.  
-¿Dónde estamos? Nuestras oficinas se encuentran en Serrano Galvache, 56 (metro línea 1 - Bambú).




Gracias por tu interés en Hitachi Rail. Si tu solicitud es de interés, nos pondremos en contacto contigo. Por favor, no dudes en descubrir más sobre nosotros y nuestras nuevas vacantes en https://www.hitachirail.com/careers .

En Hitachi Rail, hay un lugar para todos/as. Acogemos y valoramos las diferentes experiencias, edad, género, sexualidad, situación familiar, discapacidad, origen, nacionalidad, etnia, religión, y visión del mundo. Es nuestro compromiso crear un entorno inclusivo - estamos orgullosos/as de ser un empleador paritario.  

Nos encantaría que fueras uno/a de nuestros/as seguidores/as en https://www.linkedin.com/company/hitachirail .

jobs_data.title: Rev-celerator Graduate Programme: Backend Java Software Engineer
jobs_data.description: About Revolut People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day. As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution. About The Role Our Technology team isn’t just one of the best in the industry. It’s one of the best in the world. And we’re proud of it. It’s our driving force, our engine. From building a new financial backend to creating an innovative app that millions of people around the world will use, there’s nothing (and we mean nothing) our tech team can’t do. About The Rev-Celerator Graduate Programme 🎓 Are you a recent graduate eager to shape the future of finance? Ready to make a meaningful impact and bring innovative ideas to life? Well, the Rev-celerator Graduate Software Engineer programme is designed just for you. First, kick off with a few weeks of bootcamp, where we’ll prepare you to jump into work at Revolut with workshops, lectures, and practical exercises to start developing your skills. After successful preparation, we’ll launch you into on-the-job training where you’ll be face-to-face with tough challenges, problem-solving, and tasks to own. The Rev-celerator Graduate programme is now open to international candidates willing to relocate to our tech hubs in Poland, Portugal, and Spain. Get support on visa application (if needed), relocation cost and the first month of accommodation. We’re looking for Java Engineers interested in every step, stage, and release of a feature. Want to work alone? This isn’t for you. We want communicators. One minute you’re chatting to a Product Owner, the next a Designer, and then a customer (for feature feedback, we don’t need you on the phones). Like your projects varied? This is for you. We don’t pigeonhole. We want you to spread your wings to as many places as possible. Up for the challenge? Let's get in touch 🚀 What You’ll Be Doing -Collaborating with engineers across various tech stacks -Building mobile APIs -Developing micro-services to evolve our architecture -Optimising existing critical systems that our business depends on, such as Risk Management, Fraud Detection, andPayment Processing -Focusing on new greenfield projects and development work. What You'll Need -A 2:1 predicted or achieved grade (or above) -To have graduated university in 2023, 2024, or 2025 -A portfolio of multiple coding side projects or open source contributions -Studies of Computer Science, Maths, Physics, or a similar subject -A proactive attitude -Love for problem-solving -Fluency in English -Quick learner with an ambitious and results-driven personality -Excellent communication and organisational skills -To feel comfortable working as part of a team in a fast-paced environment -Full-time availability for the programme starting in September 2025 Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team. Refer to our https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

jobs_data.title: Software Engineer II - Testing Infrastructure
jobs_data.description: Testing Infrastructure aims to provide the tooling and platforms which allow Datadog developers to ship services at scale with ease and confidence. Engineers on this team will have organization-wide impact by increasing development velocity and the reliability of our products and systems. As an engineer on a growing team, you will have many opportunities to work on green-field projects and help shape the future of Datadog developer experience. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships that it builds, the creativity it brings to the table, and the collaboration of being together. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our employees can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You'll Do: -Work on platforms and tooling that enable engineers to run, debug, and test their services across multiple environments -Build out a new integration testing platform and tooling to help onboard new and existing tests -Improving our visibility into test health to help developers write and maintain effective tests -Champion best practices across the engineering organization Who You Are: -You have 2+ years of experience working on services or infrastructure in a microservice-heavy environment -You have experience collaborating with internal or external customer teams -You have proficiency in at least one of Python, Go, and/or Java -You have familiarity with DevOps and resilience best practices -You have strong written and verbal communication skills -You take a curious and solution-oriented approach to challenges Bonus points for: -You have interests that bridge infrastructure, developer experience, and reliability. -You have experience building out and deploying containerized services with Kubernetes and cloud providers such as AWS or GCP -You have driven improvements to testing capabilities and/or practices for developers across teams, platforms, or organizations Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: -New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) -Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing -Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking -An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups) -Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussions -Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ -Competitive global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. About Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center. Equal Opportunity at Datadog: Datadog is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our Candidate Legal Notices for your reference. Your Privacy: Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice.

jobs_data.title: Software Engineer
jobs_data.description:
We, at  Rasayel  (https://rasayel.io), are a small, sharp-focused and deliberate team. We built Rasayel to help businesses support, sell and market to customers over WhatsApp. We started small with a stellar group of designers, engineers, and product folks. We do dream big, and we have plenty of big plans. We have recently raised our seed round. We want to tackle our next set of exciting challenges in the next years to come and this is where YOU come into the picture, we want your help for us to do so.
You will get to work with product, engineering and design folks who are ex-Intercom,  Instabug,  and Evervault  as well as folks who built popular open-source libraries like  vee-validate. We are open, kind, inclusive and forward-thinking. You will find zero of the big tech co-bureaucracies or politics. We are all about good, deliberate, quality and meaningful work. :)
Here are few pieces of work you will have a chance to work on
      -Building infrastructure for our WhatsApp Business API offering.
-Building a Bot framework tailor made for WhatsApp.
-Re-architecting our internal messaging pipeline.
-Rearchitecting & improving our internal messaging pipeline.
-Building infrastructure for meaningful marketing over WhatsApp.
-Building Public APIs & Webhooks.
-Grokking through our GraphQL layer or measuring queries performance
-And many more equally exciting and challenging projects!


About the role
We are looking to hire a  Software Engineer  to join our small distributed team around different parts of Ireland, Belgium, Spain, Turkey, Egypt, and Canada. Ideally, we are looking for a generalist, someone who can wear many hats, someone who is pragmatic, a product engineer at heart and most importantly, who thinks from first principles (https://fs.blog/2018/04/first-principles). We work remotely, so this is a 100% remote role. You can choose to work anywhere you'd like having a few hours overlapping with GMT+0.
About you
A little bit about what we think can be a good fit for us,
* You are a product engineer at heart.* You have worked with Ruby on Rails.* You aren't afraid to dabble in Rails internals if you need to.* You worked extensively with PostgreSQL, and you can write raw SQL if you need to.* You worked with REST, and GraphQL APIs and you can put an argument for using one over the other.* You aren't afraid to work with Javascript, Typescript and/or Vue.js.* You understand the value of writing tests, as an investment for the future.* You have worked with any cloud provider, preferably AWS.* You have worked with Docker and preferably touched on AWS ECS.* You have done your share of DevOps work. The more the merrier.* You write your code with empathy for your fellow Engineers and for future readers.* You favour simplicity.* You are self-driven and can self-manage.* You can write and communicate in English succinctly. You wrote technical plans before, we do write a lot.* You love to take on complex problems, and you don't shy away from fixing issues.* You have some remote experience, and you understand its challenges.* You can take and give feedback openly.* You are kind, and there is ≥5% chance we will see you smile. :)* You like to work in a small team and have direct ownership of your work.* You think of technology, not as an ideology but rather as a means to push value into the world.
Your engineering skills are as important as your entrepreneurial skills to us. We value generalists who can take a problem from its most ambiguous state and deliver its end value to solve a real-world problem for our customers. If you reach out, leave something personal so we know you actually read this. 😉
About pay & benefits
* $3,500 to $5,000 as a monthly salary.* Meaningful equity.* 100% remote, stress-free and friendly environment.* A work laptop and the equipment that you will need.* We don't have middle managers, we will work to enable you be successful and get out of the way.* You'll have the opportunity to have a massive impact due to our size and being an early stage.
No recruitment agencies, and no middleman of any kind. We never go through an agency to talk to people who want to work with us.

jobs_data.title: Full Stack Software Engineering Intern
jobs_data.description:
Company DescriptionSAC Capital is an investment firm focused on high-growth, late-stage technology companies across the Americas. We invest in businesses with strong unit economics, clear market fit, and scalable growth potential. Our mission is to support ventures that are redefining industries and advancing society through transformative innovation. At SAC Capital, we are committed to driving impactful change and believe in the power of technology to shape the future.
Role DescriptionAs a  Full Stack Software Engineering Intern  at SAC Capital, you’ll play a key role in designing, building, and optimizing components of our digital product. This internship is ideal for a computer science student or recent graduate eager to gain hands-on experience in SaaS development and cloud infrastructure, working with a talented investment team in an agile environment.
Key Responsibilities:      -Software Component Architecture: Design software components that align with our product roadmap hypotheses, supporting SAC Capital’s strategic objectives.
-Agile Product Development: Collaborate with the investment team to create and execute an agile development plan for our interactive product.
-SaaS Development Tasks:
-Integrate  Excel capabilities  for seamless data interactions within our platform.
-Develop and manage  APIs  to connect with various services and enhance platform functionality.
-Set up and maintain  cloud infrastructure  to ensure scalability, security, and performance.
-Assist in  DevOps  processes, including CI/CD pipelines, automation, and deployment strategies.

  Knowledge Requirements:      -Production Models: Understanding of production-level development and the ability to work with scalable, maintainable code.
-Machine Learning & Databases: Advanced knowledge of machine learning concepts and experience with databases.
-Cloud Platforms:
-Experience with  AWS  and  Google Cloud  for infrastructure and deployment.
-Databases:
-Proficiency in  SQL  for data storage and manipulation.
-Programming Languages:
-Proficiency in  Java  and  Python  for backend development.


What You'll LearnDuring this internship, you’ll gain hands-on experience with core technologies and real-world applications in venture capital, including:      -Full Stack Development: Work on both front-end and back-end aspects of a SaaS platform, including secure login systems, API development, and Excel integration.
-Cloud Infrastructure and DevOps: Learn to set up and manage cloud infrastructure on AWS or Google Cloud, focusing on scalability, security, and cost-efficiency. Gain experience with DevOps, including CI/CD pipelines and automated deployment.
-Agile Development: Participate in all aspects of agile workflow, from sprint planning to retrospectives, learning how to apply agile methodologies to full stack development.
-Database Management: Develop an understanding of database management with SQL, focusing on performance optimization and efficient data handling.
-Production-Level Code Quality: Learn best practices for writing clean, maintainable, and scalable code that meets industry standards.
-Collaboration in a Product-Focused Environment: Work closely with SAC Capital’s investment and product teams, gaining exposure to product roadmap planning and how each development component aligns with SAC’s strategic goals.


Qualifications      -Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
-1-3 years of experience  in software development or related fields (internships and coursework count)
-Programming Proficiency: Experience with  Java  and  Python  for backend development
-Cloud Platforms: Familiarity with  AWS  or  Google Cloud
-Databases: Proficiency in  SQL  for data storage and manipulation
-Production-Level Code Quality: Understanding of scalable, maintainable, and production-ready code practices
-Familiarity with tools such as  JIRA  and  GitHub
-Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
-Knowledge of portfolio management products or finance/VC technology is a plus


Compensation and Benefits      -Unpaid Internship: This is a volunteer internship designed to provide hands-on learning experiences.
-Real-World Impact: Contribute to the development of a digital product used in venture capital decision-making.
-Mentorship: Collaborate closely with experienced professionals in software engineering and venture capital.
-Skill Development: Gain practical experience in SaaS development, cloud infrastructure, and DevOps.
-Flexible Schedule: Remote work options and flexible hours to fit your availability.
-Career Opportunity: High-performing interns may be considered for a full-time role upon completion of the internship.


Why Join SAC Capital?This internship is an opportunity to work closely with our investment team and gain valuable insights into the world of venture capital. If you’re passionate about software development, eager to learn, and excited to make an impact, we’d love to hear from you!
How to Apply:Please apply through LinkedIn or email us at jobs@sacvc.com. Be sure to include your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your interest in this role and how you see yourself contributing to SAC Capital.

jobs_data.title: QA Engineer
jobs_data.description: “Delivering innovative digital magazines on every device in every country” Zinio brings innovation and inspiration to the world of magazine publishers and consumers by delivering the ultimate digital reading experience on any device. As a pioneer Zinio operates online web newsstands and award-winning iOS and Android apps, providing access to digital magazines & articles in more than 30 languages, which can be read online and offline on any platform.Zinio Pro converts print magazines to digital content through a Software as a service (SaaS) platform that transforms PDF to other formats such as XML, ePub, or ANF and distributes it to different platforms such as Amazon Kindle, Apple News, or Zinio Pro’s white label publisher web and mobile apps. The company has delivered 750M digital magazine editions across more than 8,5k titles from 1.3k publishers in 200 countries to over 10M customers. We are looking for the best and brightest minds in QA. Become part of an agile team of highly skilled and motivated individuals in our Barcelona office What you will be doing: -Defining appropriate measures to ensure product quality. -Performing manual and automated System tests (functional/non-functional & regression), acceptance, and integration testing. -Developing the architecture of the testing frameworks. -Working closely with Product Owners and Developers to understand product specifics and create corresponding test plans, test cases, and test strategies. -Providing technical vision choosing the technology stack that better fits the business. -Ensuring the documentation is self-explanatory, reliable, and up to date. What we expect from you: -+2 years hands-on experience in automation -Java or any other Object-Oriented Programming Language for writing automated tests. -Domain of Appium or similar software to test mobile devices. -Testing mobile applications (iOS and Android). -Have knowledge of Device farm tools. -Have absolutely zero problems communicating yourself in English. Nice to have: -Testing REST APIs, web, desktop. -Experience with TestNG, Jenkins, Gherkin/Cucumber, CI, Gradle. -ISTQB certifications. Soft skills -Self-taught and highly perfectionist, code as a craft spirit. -Enthusiastic, engaged, pro-active, and creative team player. -Honest, direct, responsible, and transparent. -Communication abilities to work with co-workers located around the world. jobs_data.title: Firmware Engineer - Avionics and Flight System
jobs_data.location: Tres Cantos, Community of Madrid, Spain
jobs_data.description:
Sener is currently looking for Firmware Engineers (Senior and Junior) to join our Avionics and Flight System Division at our Tres Cantos work center (Madrid).

We are a pioneering engineering company in the design of satellite technology and equipment for space exploration. In defence, we design and produce equipment and systems, including unmanned systems. Our passion for precision has made us a trusted partner of leading space agencies, government agencies and companies.

What you will do:

      -Lead the definition and implementation of FW solutions: architectures, FW components, Ifs, requirements, test resources, pin-out…
-Preparation of FPGA specifications.
-Testing and debugging the developed solutions.
-Understanding HW/SW platform and being able to define SW/HW, SW/FW IFs.
-Break down the defined solution into affordable FW component and tasks, according to project context: schedule, profiles, platform…
-Participate in proposals preparation.



What we expect from you:

      -Engineering Degree.
-Between 2-6 years background in FPGA development areas (space or automotive markets preferred). Larger experiences will be as well very welcome.
-Experience in all stages of FW lifecycle: requirements & spec, architecture definition, FW implementation, validation, integration.
-Experience in defining/implementing FW architectures.
-Be able to gather and analytically understand user requirements, providing guideless for the solution not only focusing on the FPGA but as well, SW/FW/HW approaches (being able to understand requirements impact on HW and SW solutions).
-Ability to communicate technical approaches and details within small project teams, including team interactions and presentations.
-Excellent oral and written communication skills and ability to clearly articulate customer technical needs into technical specifications.
-High level of English.



We will also value:

      -Knowledge on different development environments (Xilinx, Microsemi, Questa).
-Experience in VHDL programming.
-Experience in Simulink and Matlab.
-Knowledge in C++, C#, Phyton, Go, and/or distributed OS.
-Experience in the implementation of data/signal processing solutions.
-Experience in space, automotive or defence industry environments.



What we offer:

These are some of the benefits you will enjoy at Sener:

      -Join a multidisciplinary and highly qualified team participating in technologically innovative projects at an international level.
-Continue your professional development with us and access a wide range of training (technical training, skills, languages ...).
-Take care of yourself with our physical and emotional well-being program: sports, workshops, medical service, physiotherapy ...
-Optimize your salary with our flexible remuneration plan (meal card, private health insurance, daycare tickets, etc.) and have our life and accident insurance.
-Make the way you work more flexible! We have flexible hours, teleworking policy, coworking spaces...
-Discount portal for you and specific onboarding for our international employees.
-We promote equal opportunities, diversity and inclusion of all people and we are certified as a Entidad Familiarmente responsable - efr. And from the Sener Foundation we collaborate in activities that promote the search for knowledge and contribute to the socially responsible development of engineering.



If you feel identified, we will wait for you… at Sener we want to go as far as you want to go!

jobs_data.title: Rev-celerator Graduate Programme: Backend Java Software Engineer
jobs_data.description: About Revolut People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day. As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution. About The Role Our Technology team isn’t just one of the best in the industry. It’s one of the best in the world. And we’re proud of it. It’s our driving force, our engine. From building a new financial backend to creating an innovative app that millions of people around the world will use, there’s nothing (and we mean nothing) our tech team can’t do. About The Rev-Celerator Graduate Programme 🎓 Are you a recent graduate eager to shape the future of finance? Ready to make a meaningful impact and bring innovative ideas to life? Well, the Rev-celerator Graduate Software Engineer programme is designed just for you. First, kick off with a few weeks of bootcamp, where we’ll prepare you to jump into work at Revolut with workshops, lectures, and practical exercises to start developing your skills. After successful preparation, we’ll launch you into on-the-job training where you’ll be face-to-face with tough challenges, problem-solving, and tasks to own. The Rev-celerator Graduate programme is now open to international candidates willing to relocate to our tech hubs in Poland, Portugal, and Spain. Get support on visa application (if needed), relocation cost and the first month of accommodation. We’re looking for Java Engineers interested in every step, stage, and release of a feature. Want to work alone? This isn’t for you. We want communicators. One minute you’re chatting to a Product Owner, the next a Designer, and then a customer (for feature feedback, we don’t need you on the phones). Like your projects varied? This is for you. We don’t pigeonhole. We want you to spread your wings to as many places as possible. Up for the challenge? Let's get in touch 🚀 What You’ll Be Doing -Collaborating with engineers across various tech stacks -Building mobile APIs -Developing micro-services to evolve our architecture -Optimising existing critical systems that our business depends on, such as Risk Management, Fraud Detection, andPayment Processing -Focusing on new greenfield projects and development work. What You'll Need -A 2:1 predicted or achieved grade (or above) -To have graduated university in 2023, 2024, or 2025 -A portfolio of multiple coding side projects or open source contributions -Studies of Computer Science, Maths, Physics, or a similar subject -A proactive attitude -Love for problem-solving -Fluency in English -Quick learner with an ambitious and results-driven personality -Excellent communication and organisational skills -To feel comfortable working as part of a team in a fast-paced environment -Full-time availability for the programme starting in September 2025 Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team. Refer to our https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.
